conclusion: Analyze forces on the rod and use magnetic field and resistance to find current.
U-shaped guide rail with resistor R = 3.0Ω, metal rod PQ with mass 1 kg and resistance 1.0Ω moving right at 2 m/s, magnetic field B = 1.0 T downward, distance between rails L = 1.0 m.
Magnetic force on rod is F_mag = BIL.
Rod is subject to rightward external force F to counteract magnetic force.
Net force on rod is difference between external force F and magnetic force F_mag.
Rod is subject to frictional force F_friction = μmg.
Net force equation is F - BIL = μmg.
Current I is given by I = (F - μmg) / (BL).
Direction of current is from P to Q using right-hand rule.
Magnitude of current is 0.7 A, direction is from P to Q.
